info.title: File Upload Service
info.description: HTTP service for uploading files using the tus protocol (https://tus.io)

options.description: Clients use the OPTIONS method to gather information about the Serverâ€™s current configuration.

Tus-Checksum-Algorithm.description: A Client MAY include the Upload-Checksum header in a PATCH request. Once the entire request has been received, the Server MUST verify the uploaded chunk against the provided checksum using the specified algorithm.

schema.description: A Client MAY include the Upload-Checksum header in a PATCH request. Once the entire request has been received, the Server MUST verify the uploaded chunk against the provided checksum using the specified algorithm.

Tus-Extension.description: tusExtension is a comma separated list of extensions supported by the server. This implementation supports the creation, creation-with-upload, expiration, checksum and termination extensions

schema.description: tusExtension is a comma separated list of extensions supported by the server. This implementation supports the creation, creation-with-upload, expiration, checksum and termination extensions

Tus-Max-Size.description: tusMaxSize represents the maximum allowed size of an entire upload in bytes.

schema.description: tusMaxSize represents the maximum allowed size of an entire upload in bytes.

Tus-Resumable.description: tusResumable represents a tus protocol version.

schema.description: tusResumable represents a tus protocol version.

Tus-Version.description: tusVersion is a comma separated list of protocol versions supported by the server. This implementation only supports 1.0.0.

schema.description: tusVersion is a comma separated list of protocol versions supported by the server. This implementation only supports 1.0.0.

412.description: InvalidTusResumable: If the version specified by the Client is not supported by the Server, it MUST respond with the 412 Precondition Failed status.

Tus-Version.description: Comma separated list of supported versions.

schema.description: Comma separated list of supported versions.

post.description: Clients use the POST method against a known upload creation URL to request a new upload resource.

parameters.name: Tus-Resumable
parameters.description: tusResumable represents a tus protocol version.

schema.description: tusResumable represents a tus protocol version.

parameters.name: Upload-Length
parameters.description: uploadLength represents the size of the entire upload in bytes.

schema.description: uploadLength represents the size of the entire upload in bytes.

parameters.name: Upload-Defer-Length
parameters.description: The Upload-Defer-Length request and response header indicates that the size of the upload is not known currently and will be transferred later.

schema.description: The Upload-Defer-Length request and response header indicates that the size of the upload is not known currently and will be transferred later.

parameters.name: Upload-Checksum
parameters.description: A Client MAY include the Upload-Checksum header in a PATCH request. Once the entire request has been received, the Server MUST verify the uploaded chunk against the provided checksum using the specified algorithm.

schema.description: A Client MAY include the Upload-Checksum header in a PATCH request. Once the entire request has been received, the Server MUST verify the uploaded chunk against the provided checksum using the specified algorithm.

parameters.name: Upload-Metadata
parameters.description: The Client MAY supply the Upload-Metadata header to add additional metadata to the upload creation request.

schema.description: The Client MAY supply the Upload-Metadata header to add additional metadata to the upload creation request.

schema.description: tusResumable represents a tus protocol version.

Upload-Expires.description: The Upload-Expires response header indicates the time after which the unfinished upload expires.

schema.description: The Upload-Expires response header indicates the time after which the unfinished upload expires.

Upload-Offset.description: uploadOffset represents a byte offset within a resource.

schema.description: uploadOffset represents a byte offset within a resource.

400.description: InvalidChecksumAlgorithm: The checksum algorithm is not supported by the server.

413.description: MaximumSizeExceeded: If the length of the upload exceeds the maximum, which MAY be specified using the Tus-Max-Size header, the Server MUST respond with the 413 Request Entity Too Large status.

delete.description: Clients use the DELETE method to terminate completed and unfinished uploads allowing the Server to free up used resources.

tusVersion.description: Comma separated list of supported versions.

ErrInvalidTUSResumable.description: ErrInvalidTUSResumable describes the error returned when a non-supported Tus-Resumable header is provided by the client.

tusResumable.description: tusResumable represents a tus protocol version.

uploadLength.description: uploadLength represents the size of the entire upload in bytes.

uploadOffset.description: uploadOffset represents a byte offset within a resource.

TUSCoreHeaders.description: TUSCoreHeaders defines the tus core protocol headers used in both requests and responses.

tusResumable.description: tusResumable represents a tus protocol version.

uploadLength.description: uploadLength represents the size of the entire upload in bytes.

uploadOffset.description: uploadOffset represents a byte offset within a resource.

TUSCoreRequestHeaders.description: TUSCoreRequestHeaders defines the tus core protocol request headers.

tusExtension.description: tusExtension is a comma separated list of extensions supported by the server. This implementation supports the creation, creation-with-upload, expiration, checksum and termination extensions

tusMaxSize.description: tusMaxSize represents the maximum allowed size of an entire upload in bytes.

tusResumable.description: tusResumable represents a tus protocol version.

tusVersion.description: tusVersion is a comma separated list of protocol versions supported by the server. This implementation only supports 1.0.0.

uploadLength.description: uploadLength represents the size of the entire upload in bytes.

uploadOffset.description: uploadOffset represents a byte offset within a resource.

TUSCoreResponseHeaders.description: TUSCoreResponseHeaders defines the tus core protocol response headers.

tusChecksumAlgorithm.description: A Client MAY include the Upload-Checksum header in a PATCH request. Once the entire request has been received, the Server MUST verify the uploaded chunk against the provided checksum using the specified algorithm.

uploadChecksum.description: A Client MAY include the Upload-Checksum header in a PATCH request. Once the entire request has been received, the Server MUST verify the uploaded chunk against the provided checksum using the specified algorithm.

uploadDeferLength.description: The Upload-Defer-Length request and response header indicates that the size of the upload is not known currently and will be transferred later.

uploadExpires.description: The Upload-Expires response header indicates the time after which the unfinished upload expires.

uploadMetadata.description: The Client MAY supply the Upload-Metadata header to add additional metadata to the upload creation request.

TUSExtensionHeaders.description: TUSExtensionHeaders defines the suppoterd tus protocol extension headers used in both requests and responses.

tags.name: tus
tags.description: The tus service exposes the methods required to implement the tus protocol
